definition: not yet/did not/have not/not/8th earthly branch: 1-3 p.m., 6th solar month (7th July-6th August), year of the Sheep/ancient Chinese compass point: 210°

sentences.english: It's for the British prince and his fiancee.
sentences.chinese: 這是英國王子和他的未婚妻。

sentences.english: For Wang Shuang and his fiancée, both turning 24, there was an additional complication.
sentences.chinese: 王雙和他的未婚妻都快24歲了，他們另有麻煩。

sentences.english: Oh my fiancee. blows in the wind.
sentences.chinese: 我的未婚妻，在風中搖逸。

sentences.english: His fiancee is a promising young terpsichorean .
sentences.chinese: 的未婚妻是個有前途的青年舞蹈家。

sentences.english: The man usually gives his fiancee a diamond ring as a symbol of their engagement.
sentences.chinese: 男方通常會送給未婚妻一枚鑽石戒指作爲訂婚的象徵。

sentences.english: His fiancee knitted him a pullover.
sentences.chinese: 他的未婚妻爲他織了一件套頭毛衣。

sentences.english: J: I have a fiancée back at home, and she has three kids.
sentences.chinese: 我有個未婚妻和三個孩子。

sentences.english: Do yuo mind if I call you fiancee?
My wife-to-be and I were at the county clerk's office for our marriage license.
sentences.chinese: 我和未婚妻在縣辦公室領結婚證。

sentences.english: Do I need an attorney to process my fiancés' paper work?
sentences.chinese: 我需要一個律師來處理我的未婚妻“的文件工作？

sentences.english: They returned to the king to tell him about their betrothed.
sentences.chinese: 三個王子回來向國王稟告了自己找到的未婚妻的情況。

sentences.english: My fiancee can not reach the brakes and the steering-wheel at the same time.
sentences.chinese: 我的未婚妻不能同時踩到剎車和握住方向盤。

sentences.english: Young lady man is a promising young terpsichorean .
sentences.chinese: 的未婚妻是個有前途的青年舞蹈家。

sentences.english: Jenna , this is Wendy, my fiancee.
sentences.chinese: 詹娜，這是溫迪，我的未婚妻。

sentences.english: Prince Nikolaos of Greece and his fiance Tatiana Blatnik arrive for the Government dinner.
sentences.chinese: 希臘皇室王子及其未婚妻抵達宴會現場。

sentences.english: My fiancee and I first went to a nudist beach six years ago.
sentences.chinese: 六年前我與未婚妻第一次去了裸體海灘。

definition: to flee to avoid an arranged marriage
(of a groom) to escort the bride to the wedding ceremony/fig. to take as one's wife/to marry
to break a promise of marriage
